title: Harris' or Harris's? Apostrophe battle brewing among grammar geeks
content: The selection of Tim Walz as Kamala Harris' running mate ignited a debate on possessive proper nouns ending in 'S'. Discussions arose over whether it should be 'Harris'' or 'Harris's'. Different style guides offer varying rules. Linguists like Timothy Pulju foresee 'Harris's' becoming the dominant form, although current usage varies.
summary: The selection of Tim Walz as Kamala Harris' running mate ignited a debate on possessive proper nouns ending in 'S'. Discussions arose over whether it should be 'Harris'' or 'Harris's'. Different style guides offer varying rules. Linguists like Timothy Pulju foresee 'Harris's' becoming the dominant form, although current usage varies.

title: Mob attacks, bars people from paying tribute to Mujibur Rahman
content: A mob attacked visitors heading towards the Bangabandhu Memorial Museum, where Bangladesh's first president Sheikh Mujibur Rahman was murdered in 1975. Armed assailants blocked roads, preventing people, including media and Liberation War heroes, from paying respects. Sheikh Hasina's son, Sajeeb Wazed Joy, condemned the violence, while former PM Khaleda Zia's BNP party held protests demanding Hasina's arrest.
summary: A mob attacked visitors heading towards the Bangabandhu Memorial Museum, where Bangladesh's first president Sheikh Mujibur Rahman was murdered in 1975. Armed assailants blocked roads, preventing people, including media and Liberation War heroes, from paying respects. Sheikh Hasina's son, Sajeeb Wazed Joy, condemned the violence, while former PM Khaleda Zia's BNP party held protests demanding Hasina's arrest.

title: Chicago-area school official sentenced for $1.5 million chicken wings theft during pandemic
content: Vera Liddell, ex-food service director for Harvey School District 152, was sentenced to nine years in prison for embezzling $1.5 million worth of chicken wings. Liddell admitted to diverting hundreds of unauthorized orders during the COVID-19 pandemic. The scam was uncovered in early 2022 during a budget audit. Defensive tackle Chris Jones's offer to pay restitution remains unconfirmed.
summary: Vera Liddell, ex-food service director for Harvey School District 152, was sentenced to nine years in prison for embezzling $1.5 million worth of chicken wings. Liddell admitted to diverting hundreds of unauthorized orders during the COVID-19 pandemic. The scam was uncovered in early 2022 during a budget audit. Defensive tackle Chris Jones's offer to pay restitution remains unconfirmed.

title: This US Judge was off bench for making sleepy teen wear jail clothes and handcuffs
content: Detroit Judge Kenneth King was temporarily removed from the bench after ordering a teenager to wear jail clothes and handcuffs during a court field trip, due to her attitude. Chief Judge William McConico announced King's necessary training. The incident drew criticism from the teenager’s mother and The Greening of Detroit organization.
summary: Detroit Judge Kenneth King was temporarily removed from the bench after ordering a teenager to wear jail clothes and handcuffs during a court field trip, due to her attitude. Chief Judge William McConico announced King's necessary training. The incident drew criticism from the teenager’s mother and The Greening of Detroit organization.

title: Who is 'Ketamine Queen'? Involved in Matthew Perry's death
content: Jasveen Sangha, linked to the overdose death of 'Friends' star Matthew Perry, has been implicated in a ketamine supply network. Known as the 'Ketamine Queen,' she was also associated with the 2019 overdose death of Cody McLaury. Sangha was arrested but released on bond. Her involvement in these cases is under investigation.
summary: Jasveen Sangha, linked to the overdose death of 'Friends' star Matthew Perry, has been implicated in a ketamine supply network. Known as the 'Ketamine Queen,' she was also associated with the 2019 overdose death of Cody McLaury. Sangha was arrested but released on bond. Her involvement in these cases is under investigation.

title: 'Donald Dump or Donald whatever...': Biden does a 'Trump' at Joe-Kamala joint event. Watch
content: ​At the first joint event of President Joe Biden and vice president Kamala Harris, also the Democrat presidential candidate, Biden did what Donald Trump does the best -- giving nicknames. “The guy we’re running against, what’s his name? Donald Dump or Donald, whatever, they want to get rid of this, what we passed,” Biden said talking about the health care cost initiatives of his administration.
summary: ​At the first joint event of President Joe Biden and vice president Kamala Harris, also the Democrat presidential candidate, Biden did what Donald Trump does the best -- giving nicknames. “The guy we’re running against, what’s his name? Donald Dump or Donald, whatever, they want to get rid of this, what we passed,” Biden said talking about the health care cost initiatives of his administration.

title: Tim Walz's drunken driving arrest: What happened to Kamala Harris's vice presidential candidate in 1995
content: In 1995, Tim Walz was arrested for drunken driving by Trooper Stephen Rasgorshek. Walz, then a teacher, proactively reported the incident to his principal and resigned from extracurricular duties. He turned the experience into a teaching moment for his students. The incident resurfaced as he now pursues the vice presidency.
summary: In 1995, Tim Walz was arrested for drunken driving by Trooper Stephen Rasgorshek. Walz, then a teacher, proactively reported the incident to his principal and resigned from extracurricular duties. He turned the experience into a teaching moment for his students. The incident resurfaced as he now pursues the vice presidency.

title: Did JD Vance pose with three women at boys' urinals? 'It had a message'
content: ​A photo of a young JD Vance posing with three women at a boys' urinal has surfaced on social media. The three women pretended to be using the urinals while JD was standing behind them. No context given, the photo is going viral with people commenting how weird JD Vance is around women. According to DailyMail which claimed to have sourced the photo exclusively from the 2003 yearbook of Vance's school, the photo had a special messaging.
summary: ​A photo of a young JD Vance posing with three women at a boys' urinal has surfaced on social media. The three women pretended to be using the urinals while JD was standing behind them. No context given, the photo is going viral with people commenting how weird JD Vance is around women. According to DailyMail which claimed to have sourced the photo exclusively from the 2003 yearbook of Vance's school, the photo had a special messaging.

title: US President Joe Biden supports calls for new election in Venezuela amid disputed vote
content: US President Biden endorsed the call for new elections in Venezuela after President Maduro's contested victory. The State Department highlighted transparency concerns. Brazilian President Lula suggested a coalition government, but opposition leader Maria Corina Machado opposed further elections. Venezuela has not released the full voting tallies, prompting international discussions on a political solution.
summary: US President Biden endorsed the call for new elections in Venezuela after President Maduro's contested victory. The State Department highlighted transparency concerns. Brazilian President Lula suggested a coalition government, but opposition leader Maria Corina Machado opposed further elections. Venezuela has not released the full voting tallies, prompting international discussions on a political solution.

title: Russian court sentences US-Russian dual national to 12 years in prison for $52 Ukraine charity donation
content: A Russian court sentenced US-Russian dual national Ksenia Khavana to 12 years for treason over a $52 donation to a Ukrainian charity. Khavana, a former ballet dancer, pleaded guilty after being detained in Yekaterinburg. US officials condemned the conviction, with plans to appeal underway. This case heightens concerns for US nationals in Russia.
summary: A Russian court sentenced US-Russian dual national Ksenia Khavana to 12 years for treason over a $52 donation to a Ukrainian charity. Khavana, a former ballet dancer, pleaded guilty after being detained in Yekaterinburg. US officials condemned the conviction, with plans to appeal underway. This case heightens concerns for US nationals in Russia.

title: Elon Musk sells 16,000-square-foot mansion, his last remaining home in San Francisco area
content: Elon Musk found a buyer for his last residential property, a historic mansion in Hillsborough, California, listed for nearly $32 million. Initially priced at $37.5 million, the estate features a 16,000-square-foot mansion with seven bedrooms, nine and a half bathrooms, and significant technological upgrades. The buyer and final sale price remain undisclosed as the transaction is pending.
summary: Elon Musk found a buyer for his last residential property, a historic mansion in Hillsborough, California, listed for nearly $32 million. Initially priced at $37.5 million, the estate features a 16,000-square-foot mansion with seven bedrooms, nine and a half bathrooms, and significant technological upgrades. The buyer and final sale price remain undisclosed as the transaction is pending.

title: WHO declares mpox a global health emergency: What is mpox, can the virus spread, How can it be stopped
Turkey, Iraq sign accord on military, security, counter-terrorism cooperation
content: The neighbouring countries have in recent years been at loggerheads over Ankara's cross-border military operations against the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militants based in northern Iraq's mountainous region.
summary: The neighbouring countries have in recent years been at loggerheads over Ankara's cross-border military operations against the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militants based in northern Iraq's mountainous region.

title: Secret service agent left Donald Trump at North Carolina, went to breastfeed: Report
content: A Secret Service agent on Wednesday afternoon left her position during Donald Trump's rally in North Carolina without informing the site in-charge, reports claimed. Minutes before Trump's motorcade arrived at the venue, the agent departed her post to breastfeed her child in a side room meant for agency work, the report said alleging a major security breach -- a month after Trump was shot in Pennsylvania.
summary: A Secret Service agent on Wednesday afternoon left her position during Donald Trump's rally in North Carolina without informing the site in-charge, reports claimed. Minutes before Trump's motorcade arrived at the venue, the agent departed her post to breastfeed her child in a side room meant for agency work, the report said alleging a major security breach -- a month after Trump was shot in Pennsylvania.

title: What! Man dresses as Vivek Ramaswamy at Trump's Montana rally. Here's what happened next
content: ​An influencer by the name of Dohaa the Explorer claimed he dressed up like Indian-American businessman and former GOP presidential hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy and then attended Donald Trump's Montana rally. He made a full-length YouTube video detailing how he prepared for the prank -- after many of his audience told him that he bore resemble with Vivek.
summary: ​An influencer by the name of Dohaa the Explorer claimed he dressed up like Indian-American businessman and former GOP presidential hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy and then attended Donald Trump's Montana rally. He made a full-length YouTube video detailing how he prepared for the prank -- after many of his audience told him that he bore resemble with Vivek.

Donald Trump seeks delay in sentencing for hush money case until after November election
content: Former President Donald Trump sought a delay in his sentencing for the New York hush money case until after the presidential election. His lawyer argued that proceeding before Election Day could constitute election interference. The legal team emphasised the need for more time due to the complexity of the case and Trump’s campaign as the Republican nominee.
summary: Former President Donald Trump sought a delay in his sentencing for the New York hush money case until after the presidential election. His lawyer argued that proceeding before Election Day could constitute election interference. The legal team emphasised the need for more time due to the complexity of the case and Trump’s campaign as the Republican nominee.

title: 16 villagers in eastern Congo killed as fighting continues despite a cease-fire
